meanings.definition: To remove the contents of (a body cavity)
meanings.sent1: The surgeon exenterated the tumor from the patient's abdomen.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist exenterated the ancient tomb to uncover its secrets.
meanings.sent3: The chef exenterated the pumpkin to prepare a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The detective exenterated the crime scene for any clues.
meanings.sent5: The gardener exenterated the soil to plant new flowers.

meanings.sent1: The hunter exenterated the deer after a successful hunt.
meanings.sent2: The butcher exenterated the fish for the customer.
meanings.sent3: The prankster exenterated the stuffed toy for a silly joke.
meanings.sent4: The artist exenterated the canvas to create a unique artwork.
meanings.sent5: The farmer exenterated the chicken for dinner.

meanings.definition: To remove the internal organs of (an animal)
meanings.sent1: The biologist exenterated the frog for dissection in class.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper exenterated the snake for a health check-up.
meanings.sent3: The vulture exenterated the carcass for its meal.
meanings.sent4: The scientist exenterated the rat for research purposes.
meanings.sent5: The chef exenterated the fish to prepare sushi.
